title: Customize UI to show some metadata

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: type: community request
labels.description: Indicates a feature requested by someone outside of the Argilla organization

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Some labeling jobs benefit from extra metadata to disambiguate the context. 
That is why I would like to show some of the metadata fields in the UI along the text that is being labeled.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The easiest interface to use imo would be If I could provide a simple parameter like 'metadata_view' to the labeling job.
```py
# metadata.image is a field in the `record`
metadata_view={"img":"metadata.image"} # metadata.image could be url or base64 image
#or
metadata_view={"span":"metadata.extra_info"} 
#or
metadata_view={"img":"metadata.image","span":"metadata.extra_info"} 
```
which would add an html img/span(maybe a link too) tag under the UI using that field. This wouldn't give a lot of control over the placement(html style) of the things but I feel is good enough.

A good example of a more customizable UI is [prodi.gy](https://prodi.gy/docs/custom-interfaces)

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I could just fork and modify the UI for my job(which file would I have to mod?), but I have limited web dev knowledge 😅 
Does the UI have access to the full record object?
**Additional context**
showing these fields only during labeling would be enough.

title: feat: Using new `top_k_mentions` metrics instead of `entity_consistency`
body:
This PR includes changes to use the old `entity_consistency` metrics as a `top_k_mentions` distribution.

This new function also allows values equal to 1 for the `threshold` parameter and a labeling post-filter, that can help to fine-grain the results.

Closes #1834

title: Login does not work when password contains `&`

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
Running this:

```bash
 ARGILLA_LOCAL_AUTH_DEFAULT_PASSWORD='$2y$05$A1CKLGuguBmGykWG4J7d2uUdiQBHGRg8DaAF7r7qDCzLlmsnZmNN.' python -m argilla

```

where the default password is set to `12&45`, making login fail even for the correct password.

The login through the API docs still works.

title: Kernel Dies when following the WeakSupervision ag news tutorial and using Snorkel's LabelModel()

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body: **Describe the bug** A clear and concise description of what the bug is. JupyterKernel Dies instantly when following ag news tutorial and using Snorkel's LabelModel() **To Reproduce** In the Weak Supervision ag news tutorial, label_model = Snorkel(weak_labels) # fit the model label_model.fit() ^Dies I believe the error is with Snorkel's SnorkelLabelModel When passing a much smaller l_train matrix, snorkel still segfaults. Have you folks been able to run any example successfully with snorkel labelmodel() without segfault-ing? **Environment (please complete the following information):** Jupyter-lab notebook running on MacOS Also tested on terminal

title: feat: determine execution order of weak supervision rules
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I had annotated data through weak supervision rules, which I really love, however, having many rules can be complex and combining them via query language can be a bit unintuitive from time to time. I would love to layer the application order of the rules via something similar to the [z-index](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/z-index) in CSS. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I see multiple options(sorted by 
- Assign numbers.
- Drag and drop within the UI.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Combining rules via the more complex query language. 

**Additional context**
Having set rules `deactivate` -> `DEACTIVE`  and `stolen` -> `NEGATIVE`.
It would be cool if `deactivate` -> `DEACTIVE` could only be activated and overwritten after `stolen` -> `NEGATIVE`.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25269220/200250088-e3f9fb7f-eb61-4666-9d69-9f7592b1d978.png)

title: feat: update instead of overwriting annotations from scrach for previous (multi-label) bulk-annotations
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
With the `bulk_annotate` option in the UI, each of the previously annotated examples gets overwritten instead of updating the record, which does not allow me to layer annotations.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
if a record is already annotated I would like to get the option to update instead completely overwriting annotations.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
N.A.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
"Hi, we are trying to use bulk annotation for a Multi-label dataset. We search for a word and we want to add a label to the pre-existing set of labels for each of the selected examples. Now with the current implementation of annotate_as, you can select multiple labels and apply them to all the examples which will automatically update any pre-existing labels. Is this possible in any other way?"

title: Server POST to metrics/dataset_labels:summary is slow

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Describe the bug**
Loading the web UI for the `argilla/news` with 38085 TextClassification entries takes 24 seconds. In our production server this takes 5 seconds, which is still slow.
Especially, this requests. 
POST http://localhost:6900/api/datasets/TextClassification/news/metrics/dataset_labels:summary


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

title: Bug in Text2Text Annotation

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
In Annotation works with the "Text2Text" module, I can't type annotation of more than 1 character.
After the annotation area got one character, the input area focused out so I click again the area once again(type 1 char > click > type 1 char > click > ...).
So I can type annotation text only with the "copy & paste" method with other streams.
These symptoms have occurred in every annotation area. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run docker environment
```
$docker run -d --name es-for-argilla -p 9200:9200 -p 9300:9300 -e "ES_JAVA_OPTS=-Xms512m -Xmx512m" -e "discovery.type=single-node" docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch-oss:7.10.2

```
 
2. Run argilla
```
$ python -m argilla
```
3. Build the script for register and run it
```
import argilla as rg
import pandas as pd
from datasets import Dataset

df = pd.read_excel("sample.xlsx")
df = df[['labels']]
df.columns = ["text"]
df = df.dropna()
dataset = Dataset.from_pandas(df)
dataset_rg = rg.read_datasets(dataset, task="Text2Text")

rg.log(dataset_rg, name="spell-correction")
```
4. Enter the local address "http://0.0.0.0:6900"
5. Click the "annotate" tab.
6. Enter the annotion in the text area.
7. You can see the error focused out after 1 character 

**Expected behavior**
After typing 1 character, the point has been focused out, and I can't type anymore(For the continuation, I must click again).
**Screenshots**
![](https://i.ibb.co/ZSfBFHn/2022-11-02-11-32-24.png)

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: MacOS Ventura
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: chrome
 - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: 1.0.0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 7.10.2
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. argilla:v1.0.0]: argilla:v1.0.0

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

Out of scope but related:
Do you plan to keep multiple versions of the documents online? If so it might be better to change all documentation links (not only the new ones) to a fixed version.

title: Improve score filter UI

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: ui

labels.name: area: ux

labels.name: team: frontend
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the frontend team

body: **Describe the bug** 1. score filters are not adaptable by manual input of numbers 2. the distribution chart doesn`t represent the actual data (it is smoothened out) **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: Get started - click the prediction button - click the score filter 1. manual input - try to manually input a number - it doesn't work 2. distribution chart - upload a dataset with certainties from 90%->100% (normally you don´t know the certainty distribution). - the chart shows that there is data from 25% certainty - filter the data for 50% certainty - nothing shows up - assume the filter is broken **Expected behavior** 1. I would expect to be able to provide manual input easily, like for example 95%. Sliders can be a bit finicky. 2. I would expect the chart to represent the actual distribution and maybe even start from 90% to 100% if that is the only data available. Alternatively, a barchart might be better? **Screenshots** **Environment (please complete the following information):** - OS [e.g. iOS]: iOS - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: FireFox - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: 1.0.0 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 7.19.2 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. argilla:v1.0.0]: 1.0.0 **Additional context** N.A.

title: Add comments/notes to annotation datasets to share with teammates.
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I want to collaborate on annotation with my team along with annotation guidelines. Also, I would like to keep track of potential uncertainties and potential comments of teammates during my annotation process. 

"When labeling a large corpus, it becomes important to take notes about an interesting data point or add additional metadata like a set of tags or flags to a data point to come back to it quickly. The current data model does not support such flags or custom notes."

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A logbook of comments and a document containing an introduction to the dataset.

"Extend the data model with additional tags and notes attributes which can be queried or filtered by, and are editable during hand annotation mode. Optionally, making certain fields of metadata editable during the hand labeling exercise could also fulfil the intention."

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I´ve considered having a separate document and log, but ideally, I want to have this together to avoid separation.

"One might need to keep track of the interesting / confusing data points manually, or just not validate them till the very end, which causes friction."

**Additional context**
Kind off aligns with this issue argilla-io/rubrix-roadmap#89

"
This is a productivity booster and helps you annotate faster, also helps in validating your annotations later by another annotator if they exchange data specific notes or fixes.
"

title: Actively create weak-supervision rules during labelling for TokenClassification

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: server
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the server

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

labels.name: area: ux
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Experience (UX)

labels.name: team: frontend
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the frontend team

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
During annotation, I would like to have the option to select a buttons for a active creation of weak-supervision rules during annotation based on lemmas/plurals/exact matches of an annotated word.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
When that is set and I annotate any word like for example the word "apple", I expect the rule to pick-up on all lemmas, plurals, and exact matches of "apple".

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Continuously switching between weak-supervision and manual labelling.

**Additional context**
IMO this might be extended with suggestive n-most similar labelling as in concise-concepts. Or suggestive n-most similar labelling for TextClassifcation using vectorsearch.

title: feat(Embeddings): Configure embeddings from the dataset settings
body:
In this PR I've connected the embeddings config definition with the index mapping configuration.

We still need to configure the configuration of the inner mapping from these settings. @ufukhurriyetoglu I've created a separate PR to avoid possible conflicts.

Please @ufukhurriyetoglu, take a look at it and feel free to merge it in your branch if it can help the final solution.

labels.name: type: bug

body:
In the empty workspace UI page, there's typo, an extra `y` in the code snippet:

```python
import argilla as rg

rg.log(
  y rg.TextClassificationRecord(text="my first cool example"),
  name='example-dataset'
)
```

We should resolve this for 1.0.0 release

Also the link to the docs should not point to rubrix.ml but to the new docs

title: Difficult to read explanations in UI

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
When using shap to understand in which parts of the text the model its putting attention on, the following happens:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102751804/196447625-95298ef1-e79c-4264-8be4-187ba129493a.png)

 As the probabilities of some transformers are heavily located on the extremes (or really close to 0 or to 1), the colours on the shap representation are very dark and it's difficult to read the words inside to make an analysis. Just by changing the intensity of this colours would be enough.

When loguru is not found in the system, a message is shown again and again. This PR just removes the message.

For future versions, we can include better logging customization that can be explicitly enabled. 

See #1305 

Could we create an issue and label it as a good first issue? 

cc @davidberenstein1957 @dvsrepo

title: feat: Similarity vector search client and backend
body:
I was able to decrease the failed test count to six and the errors to one error. Currently debugging the failing or error containing tests to have a clean test run.

Steps planned for the vector search task:

- Upgrade ElasticSearch version and use official python client library [ongoing]
- Opensearch server and python client upgrade, and relevant changes [planned]
- Modularize the above steps, to avoid code repetition
- Add vector search attribute to record class
- Elasticsearch knn integration 
- Opensearch knn integration 
- Final refactoring and tests for new cases 


# TODO

- [x] Elasticsearch 8.5.x integration
- [x] Integrate `k` parameter and pagination size https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pull/1973)
- [ ] Apply vector setup optimization for elasticsearch/opensearch
- [x] Compute the` num_candidates` argument for elasticsearch (opensearch has a similar setup but at index mapping definition). https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pull/1973
- [ ] Add documentation guides (or maybe a mini tutorial for data deduplication) cc @dvsrepo @davidberenstein1957 
- [x] Review python client docstrings for new record `embeddings` client property.
- [x] ~~Enhance python client usability (allow passing numpy arrays or pandas.Series as vector values)~~ -> Next Iteration

Closes #1757

body:
**Describe the bug**
With VueJS we should interact with virtual DOM and not with DOM directly. 
Means that if we need to add or remove class, we need to bind to the template and not add the class from document object

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'

bind the class "--fixed"

```bash
/datasets/{name}/{task}/...
```

```bash
/dataset/{task}/{name}...
``` 

as deprecated

This change does not affect the API functionality

See: recognai/roadmap#22

title: fix: normalizes the UnauthorizationError for the API response
ci: Upload coverage report only once
Bugfixes/review pr 1709
body:
With this change, errors will be shown as following:
```bash
ValueError: Following entity spans are not aligned with provided tokenization
Spans:
- [Th] defined in This is...
- [his is] defined in This is a te...
- [is a text in Ja] defined in This is a text in Japan. ...
- [a t] defined in ...s is a text i...
Tokens
['This', 'is', 'a', 'text', 'in', 'Japan', '.', 'And', 'This', 'too', 'but', 'for', 'Paris']
```

title: Bugfixes/review pr 1687
body:
Some changes related to the usage telemetry:

- Passing system data as event context (will simplify later integrations)
- Show warning message on server start to clear preventing users
- Include the Telemetry section inside the Reference doc.

title: docs: raise small-text version to 1.1.0 and adapt tutorial
body:
Hi,

with the new small-text v1.1.0 release the requirement that all classes must be in the training data (#1693) is now gone and should not cause any more problems.

- Moreover, I changed the code to use the new convenience methods to construct a `TransformersDataset`.
- The small-text imports have (finally) been cleaned up and you can import all public methods from the top level.
- For dataset construction, passing the target_labels is now recommended (and I changed that as it returns a warning otherwise).
- Since the new TREC dataset (despite your configured `revision` parameter) always fell back to the old version (which resulted in an error since the attributes don't mach) therefore I changed this to use the `version` parameter instead. This seems to work well and it is probably reasonable to pin the example to a dataset version. 

- Proposal: I changed the transformer model name to use a larger model if a GPU (i.e. if CUDA) is available. Otherwise, with only the tiny model, people might undererstimate the strength of this combination.

I did manually test it only until the labeling starts. Sorry, short on time today :).

This PR is just intended to make this as easy as possible for you. Don't feel obligated to use this and change/revert anything that does not fit.

title: Env var to disable authentication

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: type: community request
labels.description: Indicates a feature requested by someone outside of the Argilla organization

labels.name: status: stale
labels.description: Indicates that there is no activity on an issue or pull request

body:
Having deployed Rubrix in our kubernetes cluster, I secured the ingress with oauth2-proxy to only allow access to internal users. However, the 'authentication' header used for Rubrix user/apiKey auth conflicts with the tokens set by oauth2-proxy.

Currently I have removed oauth2-proxy, but it would be wonderful if an ENV var could be set to allow users to access to Rubrix without it checking for any auth token.

Will understand if this is not worth the time, but thought I'd share the use-case. Thanks for a great application!

title: fix(#1658): align agents for predictions annotations
body:
This PR includes changes related to #1658 to align/normalize predictions/annotations keys with the `agent` fields:

- For the `prediction` field, agents will be computed from the key
- For the `predictions` field, agents will be set to `None`

title: fix: handle separately 401 and 403 api errors in UI
body:
Since the changes included in #1713, users without permission trying to delete datasets from UI will hit into a re-login operation.

This PR handles separate authentication errors (401) and forbidden errors (403).

We should find a better way to handle error codes and info in general.

Refs: #1713

title: Manage "keyword" metrics info in special use cases

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

labels.name: area: ux
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Experience (UX)

labels.name: team: frontend
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the frontend team

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Sometimes there are no provided keywords and sometimes the keyword list is infinite. We need to adapt a solution for these extremes use cases.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The keyword list is empty: indicate that the list is empty and how to create a keywords
The keyword list is long: define a max to show and facilitate a "show more" navigation

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Facilitate a solution that fit with similar situation. ( ex: token class)
It happens the same when the dataset has a lot of entities
